newsitem.title: CHINA: Cathay adds HK-Colombo weekly flight.
newsitem.headline: Cathay adds HK-Colombo weekly flight.

text.p: Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd said on Sunday it will add another flight from Hong Kong to Colombo, bringing the number to three each week.
The flight will operate every Monday, starting on July 7, to add to the existing services on Tuesday and Saturday, the airline said in a statement.
The carrier runs three weekly flights from Colombo to Hong Kong -- on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Sundays.
All Cathay flights into and out of Colombo will operate via Bangkok, the airline said.
It will use Airbus Industrie A330-300 aircraft on the route, it said.
Cathay's A330-300 fleet resumed service early last month after being grounded with engine trouble in late May.
